Class Coyote

java.lang.Object
  Animal
      Coyote

public class Coyote
extends Animal

A simple model of a Coyote. Coyotes age, move, eat foxes, and die.

Version:
2014.15.12
Author:
Avraham Amon

Constructor Detail

Coyote

public Coyote(boolean randomAge,
              Field field,
              Location location)
Create a coyote. A coyote can be created as a new born (age zero and not hungry) or with a random age and food level.

Parameters:
randomAge - If true, the coyote will have random age and hunger level.
field - The field currently occupied.
location - The location within the field.
Method Detail

act

public void act(java.util.List<Animal> newAnimal)
This is what the coyote does most of the time: it hunts for foxes. In the process, it might breed, die of hunger, or die of old age.

Specified by:
act in class Animal
Parameters:
field - The field currently occupied.
newAnimal - A list to return newly born animal.
